005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatTypes;
009
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.AbstractCustomJavaDataTypeAdapter;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.object.AmbiguousDateTime;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IDateTimeItem;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
016import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
017
018import java.time.LocalDateTime;
019import java.time.ZoneOffset;
020import java.time.ZonedDateTime;
021import java.time.format.DateTimeParseException;
022import java.util.List;
023
024import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
025
026/**
027 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
028 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#date-time">date-time</a>
029 * data type.
030 */
031public class DateTimeAdapter
032    extends AbstractCustomJavaDataTypeAdapter<AmbiguousDateTime, IDateTimeItem> {
033  @NonNull
034  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
035      List.of(
036          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "date-time"),
037          // for backwards compatibility with original type name
038          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "dateTime")));
039
040  DateTimeAdapter() {
041    super(AmbiguousDateTime.class, IDateTimeItem.class, IDateTimeItem::cast);
042  }
043
044  @Override
045  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
046    return NAMES;
047  }
048
049  @Override
050  public JsonFormatTypes getJsonRawType() {
051    return JsonFormatTypes.STRING;
052  }
053
054  @Override
055  public AmbiguousDateTime parse(String value) {
056    AmbiguousDateTime retval;
057    try {
058      retval = parseWithTimeZone(value);
059    } catch (DateTimeParseException ex) {
060      try {
061        retval = parseWithoutTimeZone(value);
062      } catch (DateTimeParseException ex2) {
063        IllegalArgumentException newEx = new IllegalArgumentException(ex2.getLocalizedMessage(), ex2);
064        newEx.addSuppressed(ex);
065        throw newEx;
066      }
067    }
068    return retval;
069  }
070
071  @NonNull
072  private static AmbiguousDateTime parseWithTimeZone(@NonNull String value) {
073    return new AmbiguousDateTime(
074        ObjectUtils.notNull(ZonedDateTime.from(DateFormats.DATE_TIME_WITH_TZ.parse(value))),
075        true);
076  }
077
078  @NonNull
079  private static AmbiguousDateTime parseWithoutTimeZone(@NonNull String value) {
080    LocalDateTime dateTime = LocalDateTime.from(DateFormats.DATE_TIME_WITH_OPTIONAL_TZ.parse(value));
081    return new AmbiguousDateTime(
082        ObjectUtils.notNull(ZonedDateTime.of(dateTime, ZoneOffset.UTC)),
083        false);
084  }
085
086  @Override
087  public String asString(Object obj) {
088    AmbiguousDateTime value = toValue(obj);
089    return ObjectUtils.notNull(value.hasTimeZone()
090        ? DateFormats.DATE_TIME_WITH_TZ.format(value.getValue())
091        : DateFormats.DATE_TIME_WITH_OPTIONAL_TZ.format(value.getValue()));
092  }
093
094  @Override
095  public IDateTimeItem newItem(Object value) {
096    AmbiguousDateTime item = toValue(value);
097    return IDateTimeItem.valueOf(item);
098  }
099}
